text:
I‚Äôve tried a lot of cat litters, but the Arm & Hammer Clump & Seal Platinum is by far the best. It‚Äôs 100% worth the money ‚Äî I‚Äôm never switching to anything else. The litter keeps odors completely under control; my house doesn‚Äôt smell like cat waste at all, even after a few days.

I love the fine sand texture ‚Äî not rocks ‚Äî which makes it comfortable for my cats, easy to scoop, and keeps the clumps tight so it lasts longer. It really covers waste perfectly. Plus, it doesn‚Äôt track or stick to paws, so my floors stay clean.

Overall, it‚Äôs clean, odor-free, and my cats actually seem to prefer it. If you want a litter that works as advertised and makes your life easier, this is it.

text:
I think this cat litter is very effective in that it eliminates odors and clumps very well. However, after doing some research on this cat litter, this is what I have found. Yes, ARM & HAMMER Clump & Seal Platinum Cat Litter contains several chemicals, including preservatives, fragrance, and process aids. The ingredient list includes sodium bicarbonate (baking soda) for deodorization.
Other ingredients include C15-30 hydrotreated alkanes and C20-50 hydrotreated alkanes, which are used as process aids. The general risks associated with cat litter ingestion or exposure when cats clean themselves include:
Intestinal obstruction if large amounts of litter are ingested, especially crystalline types.
Gastrointestinal upset, such as vomiting or constipation, from ingestion of any litter type.
Respiratory irritation in sensitive cats, particularly from scented or dusty litters.
Allergic reactions, including paw swelling or skin lesions, to certain litter materials.
The litter also contains preservatives such as benzisothiazolinone and methylisothiazolone, which are known to prevent microbial growth.
Additionally, fragrance is included to provide a scent, and C12-15 alcohols ethoxylated is used as an absorbent aid.
The product also features a proprietary adhering ingredient that helps form hard clumps by binding particles to feces. This is probably why the cat litter smells like plastics.
While the main ingredients are derived from mineral and plant sources, the inclusion of synthetic additives like preservatives and fragrance indicates the presence of chemicals beyond natural components. You decide if this litter is safe for your cat.
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 28 de octubre de 2025
title: May not be good for your cat!
